questions.question: There ……………………… no one in the room.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: This year, there ………………………… many mangoes on the tree.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ………………………… many people interested in buying cars.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ………………………. many jobs in the market now.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There …………………………. many unemployed young people in developing countries.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ……………………….. a lot of commotion in the street.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: There ……………………….. something under the bed.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: There ………………………… many students in the class.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: ……………………….. there any milk in the fridge?
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: There ………………………. tremendous support for him.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: …………………….. there any effective solution to this problem?
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.
